pros: Collegial environment Clear performance objectives Satisfying mission Benefits are very good
cons: Minimal annual increases Cold in winter

review_title: Work is rewarding, signing up for benefits is tough
pros: Working for UW Oshkosh is rewarding, engaging, and great for building skills.
cons: Getting signed up for benefits was a nightmare, enrollment period was 2 days, then trying to sign up after window closed to 2 months for coverage to be approved and start. Parking

pros: Great professional staff who work hard and care and value their team members.
cons: Low paying job with minimal opportunities for advancement

review_title: Cleaning crew are child like, will watch everyone else and hide instead of doing their jobs
job_title: Facilities Technician in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: Benefits are fairly good pay is not
cons: Their cleaning crew are child like.

pros: the pay, benefits, and support from upper staff is nice
cons: There are not many, sometimes classroom behaviors are overwhelming

job_title: Financial Specialist I in Oshkosh, WI
pros: good flexibility depending on department, better insurance than other places I've worked
cons: low pay, a battle to get any raise

pros: Get to help students reach goals.
cons: No one seems to know what they’re doing. No training/mentoring provided.

pros: I haven't worked at UWO for a full year yet, but it is a great place to work. Wonderful benefits, great coworkers/environment. And there is a plethora of resources for assistance if needed.
cons: Can be a bit slow at times.

pros: Great faculty to work with
cons: Part time requires a lot of work

job_title: Executive Director of Clinical Operations in Oshkosh, WI
pros: I've a personal great mngr.
cons: To many chief's, it's a man's world....

pros:
-Good work/life balance
-Vacation & sick time exceeds many other places. Health insurance is also insanely affordable. 
-Frequently hire from within.
-Nice on campus events to attend regularly.
-Variety of projects - rarely bored, but also never overwhelmed.
cons:
-Parking can be $300+ for one year, depending. 
-Raises are hard to come by (not even COLA), and when they do come around they're small (although this was recently evaluated and they are trying to fix it.)
-Not the greatest pay in the first place.
-Liberal, many conversations and trainings around equity, race, LGBTQIA+ issues, etc.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Fond du Lac, WI
pros: The people working on campus were genuinely great. Teaching there is rewarding.
cons: Higher Ed is being defunded, which is difficult and stressful.

pros: My coworkers are great and the job is easy
cons: Very few hours to go around

pros: just a great place to be
cons: a lot of work to be done

job_title: Preschool Teacher Assistant in Appleton, WI
pros:
benefits
vacation and sick time
love that the job is rewarding and management takes care of you
cons: coworkers have some drama but it is a good position to be in with a lot of support from other staff, and the children are fun to be around. it is also nice to know i am making a difference for families who need help

review_title: Good state university, low wages for faculty
pros: liberal art education, service to the community, nice state university that serves its residents with high quality education
cons: very white, white male dominated leadership, suppressed wage

pros: got to work with same people
cons: no consistent work schedule, always too short of staff

review_title: Its a great job to have in school but pay is low
pros: Easy job, Not crazy hours, Not super stressful, easy work life balance, Can study at work
cons: Low pay, can be boring, Not enough hours if you want them

pros: Good Place to Work At
cons: Nothing really to say about it

pros: Good benefits and reasonable pay.
cons: Not stable employment. Contract can end on a whim.

job_title: Assistant Conference Coordinator in Oshkosh, WI
pros: The job is not demanding.
cons: Housing has stripped its employees of all of benefits except the directors.

job_title: Supervisor At the Corner Convenience Store in Oshkosh, WI
pros: Great atmosphere, can pick your own schedule, flexible hours, great management, On-campus, learn great communication skills, gain social skills, gain organization skills, can work with school friends.
cons: Have to work some weekends.

pros: Good benefits (health, dental, vision)
cons: Parking passes are too expensive

pros: Culture, benefits, educational opportunities, growth, values
cons: work life balance, some leadership

pros: People, time off, hours, and nothing else.
cons: Pay, no raises, benefits get worse year after year

job_title: Marketing Team Coordinator in Oshkosh, WI
pros: Freedom, Room to Grow, Encouraging, Learning Opportunity
cons: Low pay, but this was a student-held position

pros: Great place for learning and getting a good degree
cons: As of right now there aren't any cons

review_title: Great place to work but limited social life.
pros: UW Oshkosh has been growing and improving significantly in the past few years. There are 4 new buildings on campus and a brand new business school. People are friendly, welcoming, and hard working. Almost no internal politics when compared to other universities.
cons: The city is fairly small and there is no much social life going. There are a couple of bigger cities 1.5 hours drive away, though. The place is great if you have small children and need safe environment, but if one is more open minded and enjoys diversity, he/she won't find it here. Overall, salaries are below average, but the cost of living also is not high.

job_title: Lab Assistant for the Computer Science Department in Oshkosh, WI
pros:
My supervisor was very accommodating in regards to hours I neglected to log during the current pay period and allowed them to be rolled over into the next pay period instead.

Overall, the job was very rewarding and a great resume builder.
cons: The website with which you log your hours was frankly a bit outdated.  It forces you to enter times in a specific form (instead of just using popups with a standard format) and doesn't easily allow for issues like entering three non-consecutive punches in one day.

review_title: Nice organization, but not much work to do. . .
pros: The University offered excellent technology training.  The environment was pleasant and co-workers were eager to show me the ropes.
cons: My boss gave me 5-10 minutes of work per day.  The rest of the time I was just supposed to entertain myself. . .The days were very long.  I learned I have too much work ethic to get paid $14+/hr to do almost nothing.

pros: Great benefits. Great support.  Environment is very inviting and always has a young, fresh feel.  The opportunity for growth within a positions is pretty good.
cons: Leadership seems to be unsteady.  There is no clear direction of the university and not good communication of what is happening at a higher level.  There seems to be lots of new upper administration hired and cutting at the bottom when people leave positions.

pros: The people on campus are generally very bright, and they are helpful to each other.  The town is reasonably safe, and the schools are good.
cons: The state legislature and governor are currently at war with their own employees.  The problem isn't just that you will never get a raise, the more serious problem is the constant attacks on you as a "lazy elite."  Don't expect to hear a "thank you" during the current political era.  As a Wisconsin native I never saw this coming and am really disappointed by how long it has lasted.

pros: Very relaxed environment with a focus on education on semi-modern technologies. The leadership is pretty friendly. The desktops were powerful and perfect to develop on. Flexible hours.
cons: The minimum working hours is 15 for the semester and expected to work full time during breaks. The pay is kind of low but probably great for people who live near campus. Barely any room to grow.

pros: Working with college students is extremely rewarding. The campus is beautiful from the outside grounds and architecture to the artwork and building environment inside. Campus life is vibrant and alive with events and student involvement opportunities as much as you'd like to attend. This isn't for everyone but for me I wouldn't trade it for anything!
cons: Parking. Sometimes can be a task but it's never as bad as Madison and it gives you a chance to get a little exercise.

review_title: Worked in the campus Writing Center and had good experience
pros: The pay is pretty good, the other employees are nice and friendly, and the work schedule is very reasonable (~10 hour weeks part-time for a student)
cons: The work ebbs and flows with how much students need you; sometimes we're insanely busy and have to turn people away, and other times you have to scrounge to find work. Not allowed to do homework during shifts, even if there's nothing else to do.

pros: Worked in the Dean's office for the College of Education and Human Services. Enjoyed my time there. Everyone was helpful and seemed to enjoy being there. They were very flexible with schedules.
cons: There were often a lot of downtimes, which could be considered a pro as well for some people.

pros: amazing co workers, great work/life balance, challenging job with room to grow and opportunities for advancement, tuition reimbursement, and they offer to help you get your technical certifications
cons: Working in anything tangentially related to education in Wisconsin right now is a minefield with very little stability. Departments are being forced to downsize with very little notice.

pros: good benefits, direct manager was very responsive to ideas and change.  Vacation is clear cut and many paid holidays.  consistent work schedule.
cons: no chance to move up, some coworkers have bad attitudes. If tou show yourself to be efficient and effective in your work you will be rewarded with other peoples work that they cannot finish appropriately.  This is from master level employees.

pros: Love the people I work with and enjoy the collaborative environment. I also enjoy the opportunity to reinvent myself and the focus of my work and my energy. The flexibility allows me to grow without having to leave the University.
cons: Benefits aren't what they used to be and pay hasn't kept pace with inflation.

pros: Excellent way to be introduced to a management position. Many responsibilities that encompass both the student union and dining hall. Upper management was an absolute amazing resource for growing as an individual and as a leader.
cons: If other team members didn't get the task done, you were left with finishing it up. Comes with the responsibilities, and college atmosphere.

pros: You are able to schedule your hours and choose which classes you want to tutor.
cons: The tutor center is one room with tables situated closely, in which there are multiple tutor sessions happening at once; it can be hard for the tutor or the client to focus.

pros: None that I can think of.
cons: We are treated poorly by management. All most all of our rights have been taken away. The pay is poor and getting worse. Benefits are being taken away. Poor attitude among employees.

job_title: Children's Center Director in Oshkosh, WI
pros:
Community Atmosphere
Fair pay and benefits
Collegiate Mentality
Something for everyone
Welcoming
Organized and runs smoothly
cons: The Governor's lack of support for the University System and Wisconsin Schools

pros: The best part was increasing attendance at sporting events to develop an incredible atmosphere.
cons: The disappointment when we crowd numbers were low for events.

pros: Work is mostly stress free. Facilities are quite good and plenty of family time.
cons: HR department is horrible. They always make mistake in salary preparation.

review_title: I was a student laboratory technician
pros: Great experience and resume building. Awesome people and culture.
cons: Sometimes organization and management is not the best.

pros:
Very relaxed work environment.
Everyone is very nice and helpful.
Learn a lot
cons: You set your own timescale and make sure you can get stuff done on time

pros: Benefits, the company cares about work/life balance.
cons: Unfortunately  do to budgets cuts some programs are eliminated

pros: Friendly environment, plentiful training and assistance, helpful staff, flexible hours.
cons: Low starting pay, but pay raises were offered as incentives to attend tutoring workshops.

pros: Entry level work, slow paced
cons: Can get repetitive and must do cleaning

pros: Benefits were good, good work.life balance
cons: State politics is ruining moral.

pros: Nice location, peaceful surroundings and no traffic
cons: Stuck in the middle place

pros: Great work environment to have.
cons: Budget cuts aren't very nice.

pros: Good management and some solid faculty
